threat: If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could possibly exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
If a user had scripting enabled, an attacker could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
If a user had scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.
